item.title: Windows 11's Recall AI is now rolling out on Copilot+ PCs
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Microsoft has confirmed that Windows Recall is rolling out to everyone with Windows 11 KB5055627 on Copilot+ PCs. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5055627 update released with 30 new changes, fixes
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: ​​Microsoft has released the KB5055627 preview cumulative update for Windows 11 24H2 with many new features gradually rolling out, and some new bug fixes for everyone. [...]

item.title: Craft CMS RCE exploit chain used in zero-day attacks to steal data
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Two vulnerabilities impacting Craft CMS were chained together in zero-day attacks to breach servers and steal data, with exploitation ongoing, according to CERT Orange Cyberdefense. [...]

item.title: Marks & Spencer pauses online orders after cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: British retailer giant Marks & Spencer (M&S) has suspended online orders while working to recover from a recently disclosed cyberattack. [...]

item.title: Mobile provider MTN says cyberattack compromised customer data
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: African mobile giant MTN Group announced that a cybersecurity incident has compromised the personal information of some of its subscribers in certain countries. [...]

item.title: Windows "inetpub" security fix can be abused to block future updates
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A recent Windows security update that creates an 'inetpub' folder has introduced a new weakness allowing attackers to prevent the installation of future updates. [...]

item.title: Baltimore City Public Schools data breach affects over 31,000 people
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Baltimore City Public Schools notified tens of thousands of employees and students of a data breach following an incident in February when unknown attackers hacked into its network. [...]

item.title: SAP fixes suspected Netweaver zero-day exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: SAP has released out-of-band emergency NetWeaver updates to fix a suspected remote code execution (RCE) zero-day flaw actively exploited to hijack servers. [...]

item.title: FBI seeks help to unmask Salt Typhoon hackers behind telecom breaches
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The FBI has asked the public for information on Chinese Salt Typhoon hackers behind widespread breaches of telecommunications providers in the United States and worldwide. [...]

item.title: Microsoft announces fix for CPU spikes when typing in Outlook
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says it will soon fix a known issue causing CPU spikes when typing messages in recent versions of its classic Outlook email client. [...]

item.title: Hackers abuse OAuth 2.0 workflows to hijack Microsoft 365 accounts
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Russian threat actors have been abusing legitimate OAuth 2.0 authentication workflows to hijack Microsoft 365 accounts of employees of organizations related to Ukraine and human rights. [...]

item.title: Lazarus hackers breach six companies in watering hole attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: In a recent espionage campaign, the infamous North Korean threat group Lazarus targeted multiple organizations in the software, IT, finance, and telecommunications sectors in South Korea. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes machine learning bug flagging Adobe emails as spam
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says it mitigated a known issue in one of its machine learning (ML) models that mistakenly flagged Adobe emails in Exchange Online as spam. [...]

item.title: Frederick Health data breach impacts nearly 1 million patients
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​A ransomware attack in January at Frederick Health Medical Group, a major healthcare provider in Maryland, has led to a data breach affecting nearly one million patients. [...]
